Kagiso Eric Mhlanga  
10 FENWICK ROAD, HOUGHTON REGIS, LU5  5RP 
MOBILE : 07446346729  | EMAIL : kemhlanga@gmail.com  | LINKED IN: www.linkedin.com/in /kagiso -eric-mhlanga  
Recently graduated with an Upper Second -Class Honours degree from the University of Leeds, having studied chemical 
engineering as an Integrated Masters ’ degree. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills couple d with an ability to 
work effectively both individually and collaboratively as part of a team when required: thriving in challenging and fast -
moving environments by prioritising tasks and targets with strong time management skills and exceptional work disc ipline . 
Experience in engineering, consulting, and data analysis through internships at the Royal Navy, Bright Network and Lab 
Technician.  
E Kagiso Eric Mhlanga  
10 FENWICK ROAD, HOUGHTON REGIS, LU5  5RP 
MOBILE : 07446346729  | EMAIL : kemhlanga@gmail.com  | LINKED IN: www.linkedin.com/in /kagiso -eric-mhlanga  
Recently graduated with an Upper Second -Class Honours degree from the University of Leeds, having studied chemical 
engineering as an Integrated Masters ’ degree. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills couple d with an ability to 
work effectively both individually and collaboratively as part of a team when required: thriving in challenging and fast -
moving environments by prioritising tasks and targets with strong time management skills and exceptional work disc ipline . 
Experience in engineering, consulting, and data analysis through internships at the Royal Navy, Bright Network and Lab 
Technician.  
EDUCATION & QUALIFICATION  
Integrated Masters’ in Chemical Engineering | University of Leeds , 2016-2020  
Grade: 2:1  
BTEC Level 3 Extended Diploma in Engineering | UTC Central Bedfordshir e, 2014-2016  
Grade: D*D*D*  
GCSEs | The Webber Independent School, Milton Keynes , 2012-2014  
AWARDS & DISTINCTION S 
Leeds Partnership Nominee  (2020)  & Duke of York Gold (2017), Outstanding Student Award for Physics (2014)  
ENGINEERING PROJECTS  
Year 4: Enhanced Oil Recovery Using Nanoparticle  
 The Masters’ research project involved the functionalisation of carboxylic and silica nanoparticles which had the 
capability of reducing the interfacial tension and wettability required to enhance oil recovery within the reservoir.  
 The Stober technique was ut ilised for the functionalisation  of carboxylic acid silica nanoparticles along with 
characterisations methods such as scanning (SEM) and transmission electron microscopy (TEM) for analysis of 
nanoparticles.  
 Collected extensive amount of data from laborator y experiments and similar existing published papers. The data 
was analysed and the results and their potential impact on society were presented to technical and non -technical 
audiences  
Year 3: Design of a Styrene Production Plant  
 As the major component of the IChemE accredited Design Project, I completed a detailed design of a heat exchanger 
network for a styrene production plant. The  project involved in -depth research into existing heat exchanger s 
calculation  methods, analysis of experiment data, and extensive use of Microsoft Excel.  
 Led a team of 5 people to research and design a suitable facility to produce  styrene, investigating  required  raw 
materials and performing mass & energy balances  and HAZOP.  
 Utilised AutoCAD and Aspen HYSYS to create a complete engineering drawing of the column and to validate the 
calculation respectively.  
Year 2 : Production of Acetaldehyde and Heat Exchanger Design  
 Led and coordinated a team of 5 to design a new vapour pressure process to produce acetaldehyde.  
 Development of a shell and tube heat exchanger which involved the calculations of mass and energy balances, 
pressure drop and heat transfer.  
TECHNICAL SKILLS 
MS Office  MATLAB  ANSYS Fluent  Aspen HYSYS  AutoCAD  Visio  R 
 
EXPERIENCE HIGHLIGHTS  
Laboratory Technician  | UK Biocentre , January  2021– Present  
 Managed and performed quality control checks on COVID -19 samples from receipt through to sample processing 
and storage in accordance with  laboratory procedures (e.g. use of SOP ’s). 
 Operated and maintained laboratory equipment  such as liquid handling robot operation (Tecan Freedom Evo), RNA 
extractions using the automated Thermo Scientific Kingfisher and qPCR plate preparation.  
 
FastFuture Programme  | Avado, September 2020 – January  2020  
This was a virtual placement which aimed to enhance students ’ understanding of the importance of digital and data within 
established companies such as AstraZeneca, digital marketing strategies and finance fundamentals. Webinars were led by 
leading experts from AstraZeneca, BT Sport, Legal & General and Barclays through the Avado learning platform.   
Key Accomplishments:  
 Successfully collaborated with others to deliver a presentation highlighting how technology can be used to make a 
change in people ’s lives and reduce environmental impact, leading to a more sustainable life for the attention of 
BT Sport.  
Engineering Officer Intern | Royal Navy, June 2019 – August 2019  
In control of diagnosing reactors and heat exchangers, implementing engineering principles such as thermodynamics, heat 
transfer and reaction engineering. Collaborated closely with Engineers at Royal Navy, learning weapon, air, and marine 
engineering.  
Key Accomplishments:  
 Successfully prepared and delivered a presentation regarding autonomous sy stems for the attention of leading 
industry experts.  
Carer | Quantum Care, August 2017 – September 2019  
Coordinated the delivery of improved care to Dementia patients , studying healthcare plans and formulating daily records 
used by staff. Ensured the accurate completion of all administration and documentation related to patient care.  
Bartender  | Go Houghton & Restaurant, February 2016 – July 2016  
Worked independently as well as part of the team, prioritising the maintenance of excellent c ustomer service through 
building strong relationships.  Increased sales by 10%.  
POSITION OF RESPONSIBILITY  
Chemical Engineering Course Representative  | University of Leeds , October 2019 – July 2020  
Represented over 200 peers in course change -related issues, collaborating effectively with students and staff raising genuine 
concerns.  
Key Accomplishments:  
 Participated in training and development events organised by the university as well as staff -student forums and 
communicating feedback opinions/outcome s to students.  
Chemical Engineering Ambassador |University Of Leeds, October 2017 – October 2019  
Performed as a Chemical Engineering Ambassador, interacting with prospective students interested in higher education at 
the University of Leeds and exhibiting the faculty ’s facilities during open days.  
Key Accomplishments:  
 Conducted engagements with the community and prospective students, representing the university to higher 
standards, along with helping new students around the university.
